ygData.subject: An idea
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t know how difficult this would be for the programmers of Gladiator to do, but a tournament edition of glad would be fantastic. Players could submit
ygData.rawEmail:
X-Digest-Num: 13
Message-ID: <17248.13.28.959279670@...>
Date: 6 Feb 1999 23:05:12 -0000
From: shayd@...
Subject: An idea

I don't know how difficult this would be for the programmers of Gladiator to do, but a tournament edition of glad would be fantastic.

Players could submit scenarios which can be used in the course of the tournament, so there would be a lot of diversity in ideas and layout, (and less work for FS Games) and if you and your men were crushed, that was it--no continuing.

At this point (or after completing all the maps) you would receive a complex password that would contain the results of your conquest which you could submit to someone at FS Games who had a decoder.  The password might contain the type and numbers of characters you had on the last level  you played, your remaining gold, and most importantly, your level reached.

Just a suggestion, I know the people at FS Games are busy with life now, but I figured the list needed to be spewed on.

-Chris
